Class Army

java.lang.Object
Army
public class Army
extends java.lang.Object
In Army class, you create an army object taking the following features as parameters: armyName, generalSkill, armyDrill, manpower, armyTradition, technology and firepower.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Army​(java.lang.String ArmyName, double GeneralSkill, double ArmyDrill, long Manpower, double ArmyTradition, double Technology)
    Army object that takes these variables as parameters: ArmyName, GeneralSkill, ArmyDrill, Manpower, ArmyTradition, Technology.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void calculateFirepower()
    Calculates the firepower of this army for each 10 hours which is the normal period to inflict firepower to the enemy.
    double getArmyDrill()
    Gets army drill.
    java.lang.String getArmyName()
    Gets army name.
    double getArmyTradition()
    Gets army tradition.
    double getFirepower()
    Gets firepower.
    double getGeneralSkill()
    Gets general skill.
    long getManpower()
    Gets manpower.
    double getTechnology()
    Gets technology level.
    void setArmyDrill​(double drill)
    Sets armyDrill if it is between 0 and 5, else, then base value, 0, is assigned.
    void setArmyName​(java.lang.String name)
    Sets army name.
    void setArmyTradition​(double tradition)
    Sets armyTradition if it is between 0 and 100, if not then assigns the base value, 0.1.
    void setGeneralSkill​(double skill)
    Sets generalSkill if it is between 0 and 10, else, then base value, 0, is assigned.
    void setManpower​(long man)
    Sets manpower if it is larger than 0, if not then assigns the base value, 1.
    void setTechnology​(double tech)
    Sets technology level if it is between 0 and 5, if not assigns the base value, 0.25.
    java.lang.String toString()
    Returns a string representation of an army using all its features.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      public void setArmyName​(java.lang.String name)
      Sets army name.

    • setGeneralSkill

      public void setGeneralSkill​(double skill)
      Sets generalSkill if it is between 0 and 10, else, then base value, 0, is assigned.

    • setArmyDrill

      public void setArmyDrill​(double drill)
      Sets armyDrill if it is between 0 and 5, else, then base value, 0, is assigned.

    • setManpower

      public void setManpower​(long man)
      Sets manpower if it is larger than 0, if not then assigns the base value, 1.

    • setArmyTradition

      public void setArmyTradition​(double tradition)
      Sets armyTradition if it is between 0 and 100, if not then assigns the base value, 0.1.

    • setTechnology

      public void setTechnology​(double tech)
      Sets technology level if it is between 0 and 5, if not assigns the base value, 0.25.

    • calculateFirepower

      public void calculateFirepower()
      Calculates the firepower of this army for each 10 hours which is the normal period to inflict firepower to the enemy. Formula: (armyTradition + (armyDrill * technology * generalSkill)) / 1000

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of an army using all its features.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
